definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The cement combines chemically with the water it is mixed with, then hardens and strengthens.
sentences.chinese: 这种水泥与水混合后会产生化学变化而凝结硬化。

sentences.english: Weary is one kind of toxicant phenomenon which in the cell the chemical change derivation causes.
sentences.chinese: 疲劳是细胞内化学变化衍生导致的一种中毒现象。

sentences.english: Objective To study the cytochemical changes of hepatocytes in mice exposed to hypoxia.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨低氧时小鼠肝细胞的细胞化学变化。

sentences.english: Reactants in enzyme-catalyzed reactions are called substrates. Substrates bind to the enzyme to start the reaction.
sentences.chinese: 在酶的催化下发生化学变化的物质，称为底物。

sentences.english: Some kinds of acids react on metals to cause chemical changes.
sentences.chinese: 有几种酸对金属起作用，会引起化学变化。

sentences.english: This chemical change can be expressed by an equation.
sentences.chinese: 我们可用反应式表示这种化学变化。

sentences.english: As is mentioned above , substances are constantly undergoing physical and chemical changes.
sentences.chinese: 如上所述，物质总是在进行着物理变化和化学变化。

sentences.english: CONCLUSION There was no chemical reaction between quercetin and carder.
sentences.chinese: 结论槲皮素分子和载体分子之间未发生化学变化。

sentences.english: In other words, there is a big change of body chemistry when one excessively pratices masturbation.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，过度打飞机会给身体带来巨大化学变化。

sentences.english: I could feel my brain chemistry change.
sentences.chinese: 我能感受到自己脑中的化学变化。

definition: simple substance (consisting purely of one element, such as diamond)
